name: myUplink
0:
”Alexa, set Living Room temperature to 21 degrees.”
”Alexa, turn on the Bedroom.”
”Alexa, increase the Bedroom temperature.”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
With myUplink skill and Alexa, you can now interact with your myUplink devices by voice. You can ask Alexa for the temperature in your room or ask Alexa to change the temperature for you.

To use the skill, you require a device that can connect to myUplink and you need an account on myuplink.com and see if your device can be connected to myUplink. Follow the easy tutorial on myuplink.com and you are ready to control your device with Alexa in a few seconds.

To get started, select the 'Enable Skill' button in the Alexa App to link your myUplink account and discover your devices. You can click on the discover devices button or you can say "Alexa, discover my devices."

When using the skill, you need established names for your devices. You can either use the names you set up already in myUplink or change these within the Alexa app.

After you discovered your devices, you can say the following:
"Alexa, set Living Room temperature to 21 degrees."
"Alexa, turn on the boost ventilation"
"Alexa, increase the Bedroom temperature."

If you have any questions, please visit myuplink.com for more details.
